answers.answer: I had pre eclampsia with my first as well. My OB gave me a list of supplements I should take with this pregnancy to avoid toxemia. One of them is a regular baby aspirin.

U started low dose asprin when the doctor stated, it is because if you had hypertension it helps keeo your blood pressure down so u dont get it again towards the end. I dont see it being a bad thing if u start now its good to keep ur blood pressure down. I say yea
I took baby aspirin from 6 weeks to 36 weeks. I'm due in 3 days and baby is very healthy.

question: Hi my name is Jennifer I am currently pregnant with my 3rd child, I have had a history of preeclampsia with both of my two previous pregnancies. At my 13 week consultation I was asked by my doctor to start taking low dose Aspirin. However I did not, in fear that it would harm my baby or make me bleed. Now I am 18 weeks and 4 days pregnant in my second trimester and I am willing to start now and give it a try. Is it still ok to take it this later in pregnancy? Do woman usually start taking Aspirin in their second trimester? I really don't want the same complications I had with my other two sons and I realize I should have followed my doctors order, now I am afraid to ask my doc because I don't want to be a non compliant patient.
title: Low dose Aspirin and Pregnancy
